info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 3:46AM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Lodge Creek near International Border affecting Hill and Blaine Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lodge Creek...including International Border...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Lodge Creek near International Border. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, April 24 2018 - The Lodge Creek rose to near 10.3 feet this year. No impacts were reported, yet areal flooding did occur because of snowmelt in northern Hill and northern Blaine counties. The gauge is acutally in southern Alberta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:25 AM MDT Monday the stage was 8.48 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 9.2 feet Wednesday morning, and then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This forecast crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 06/04/1953. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Lodge Creek International Borde 7.0 8.48 Mon 3 am MDT 8.9 9.2 6.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM MDT.
